definitions.definition: To guess; to venture an unproven idea.
definitions.example: I do not know if it is true; I am simply conjecturing here.

definitions.definition: To infer on slight evidence; to guess at.
Of a large size or extent; great.
Great in size, and fine or imposing in appearance or impression; illustrious, dignified, magnificent.
definitions.example: His simple vision has transformed into something far more grand.

definitions.definition: Having higher rank or more dignity, size, or importance than other persons or things of the same name.
definitions.example: The Grand Viziers of the Ottoman Empire.

definitions.definition: (usually in compound forms) Standing in the second or some more remote degree of parentage or descent.
Fine; lovely.
definitions.example: A cup of tea? That'd be grand.

definitions.definition: Containing all the parts proper to a given form of composition.
That which discourages a particular behaviour; a deterrent.
Someone or something who barks.
definitions.example: My neighbor's dog is a constant barker that keeps me awake at night.

definitions.definition: A person employed to solicit customers by calling out to passersby, e.g. at a carnival.
definitions.example: Bob had amassed a considerable stockpile of double entendres from his days working as a barker for a strip joint.

definitions.definition: A shelf-talker.
A video game mode where the action is demonstrated to entice someone to play the game.
definitions.example: The barker mode of the arcade video game convinced the teenager to spend a quarter.

definitions.definition: A pistol.
The spotted redshank.
A person who removes needed or valuable tree bark, as on a cinnamon or cinchona plantation.
definitions.example: The professor of barker has been made largely obsolete by the realization that in most cases saplings can be cultivated far more profitably.

definitions.definition: A tanner.
definitions.example: The profession of barker has been made largely obsolete by the introduction of more effective tanning agents, but it lives on as a surname.

definitions.definition: A machine used to remove unneeded bark from wood.
definitions.example: Run these logs through the barker so we can use them as fence posts.

definitions.definition: The practice of taking advantage of any situations or people to achieve an end, often with no regard for principles or consequences.
A colour/color that is a dark blend of red and blue; dark magenta.
(colour theory) Any non-spectral colour on the line of purples on a colour chromaticity diagram or a colour wheel between violet and red.

Cloth, or a garment, dyed a purple colour; especially, a purple robe, worn as an emblem of rank or authority; specifically, the purple robe or mantle worn by Ancient Roman emperors as the emblem of imperial dignity.
definitions.example: to put on the imperial purple

definitions.definition: (by extension) Imperial power, because the colour purple was worn by emperors and kings.
Any of various species of mollusks from which Tyrian purple dye was obtained, especially the common dog whelk.
The purple haze cultivar of cannabis in the kush family, either pure or mixed with others, or by extension any variety of smoked marijuana.
Purpura.
Earcockle, a disease of wheat.
Any of the species of large butterflies, usually marked with purple or blue, of the genus Basilarchia (formerly Limenitis).
A cardinalate.
A recreational drug based on cough syrup, popular in the hip-hop community in the southern United States.
To turn purple in colour.
To dye purple.
To clothe in purple.
